citations.narrative:
The acquisition record for the degus did not contain all of the information required under the provisions of the Animal
Welfare Act (AWA), including the name and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired and their USDA
license number or vehicle plate/driver's license number. Additionally, the date of acquisition and number of animals in the
shipment were not accurately recorded in the acquisition record, according to the licensee. The records show that 2
degus were acquired on July 8, 2025, and the licensee stated there were eight degus acquired on June 17, 2025. Failure
to maintain required records prevents trace back of animals to their original source and does not allow inspectors to verify
that the sourcing of animals is compliant with the AWA.
The facility must ensure that records are maintained which fully and correctly disclose all required information concerning
each animal which has been purchased, or otherwise acquired, owned, held or otherwise disposed of, in its possession or
under its control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed. Correct by August 25, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The acquisition record for the degus did not contain all of the information required under the provisions of the Animal 
Welfare Act (AWA), including the name and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired and their USDA 
license number or vehicle plate/driver's license number. Additionally, the date of acquisition and number of animals in the 
shipment were not accurately recorded in the acquisition record, according to the licensee. The records show that 2 
degus were acquired on July 8, 2025, and the licensee stated there were eight degus acquired on June 17, 2025. Failure 
to maintain required records prevents trace back of animals to their original source and does not allow inspectors to verify 
that the sourcing of animals is compliant with the AWA. 
 
The facility must ensure that records are maintained which fully and correctly disclose all required information concerning 
each animal which has been purchased, or otherwise acquired, owned, held or otherwise disposed of, in its possession or 
under its control, or which is transported, euthanized, sold, or otherwise disposed. Correct by August 25, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
